StructuredXMLResume.ExecutiveSummary: An IT Professional with 13.5 years of experience in Requirement Analysis, System Study, Systems Design, Development, Testing, Integration and Implementation of complex Client/Server, Distributed n-tier and web based application systems.rnrnA diversely skilled Applications Development Programmer with a strong background and experience in designing and developing complex, sophisticated products with ambitious time schedules. Proven ability to quickly learn new technology and apply them in business solutions. Experience in leading all phases of the software life cycle (feasibility studies, estimating, system analysis, design, development, quality assurance and implementation).  Strengths include good team player, excellent communication and interpersonal, analytical and writing skills.

PositionHistory.Title: Manager & Architect
PositionHistory.Description: Description:rnPega's adaptive, cloud-architected software - built on its unified Pega® Platform - empowers people to rapidly deploy, and easily extend applications to meet strategic business needs. Over its 30-year history, Pega has delivered award-winning capabilities in CRM and BPM, powered by advanced artificial intelligence and robotic automation, to help the world's leading brands achieve breakthrough business results. This project aims at enabling devops for pega with various things likernrn- Technology modernization -single source of truthrn- Platform Development changes to align with Devopsrn- Testing strategy and toolsrn- Devops solution for product & applications & it's customersrnrnRole:rnPlayed manager / technical lead/ technical architect for team of 10 membersrnrnResponsibilities:rn● Involved in end-to-end design and development of devops solution for Pegarn● Involved in end-to-end design testing strategy for PegarnrnrnHotCompilertOpenSourceProjectrnDescriptionrnDeveloped Tool for auto compile and reload of  java files on save.  With this, you could see your changes reflecting on save just like a scripting language. Its features include the followingrn• multiple project monitoring for auto compile & reload on savern• import the project configuration from build tools like antrn• import and export of project settingsrn• hot swap through different debug transports like socket and shared memoryrn• hot swap through java agentrn• project clean/incremental compilernrnMore info about it can be found at http://hotcompiler.wordpress.com/ and It is uploaded to sourceforge at http://sourceforge.net/projects/hotcompiler/files/

JobCategory.CategoryCode: Information Technology → Operations, Monitoring and Software Management
JobCategory.Comments: Information Technology describes 61% of this job

PositionHistory.Title: Technical Lead
PositionHistory.Description: Description:rnAnalytical Common Capability(ACC) is common platform used in optum to process the  health care analytics  such as HEDIS, STAR, VBR and SYMMETRY. The aim of this project to bring processing of all analytics under one umbrella and use Hadoop for high scalability. Right now HEDIS is the only analytic which is brought to ACC. The future scope of this project is to bring STAR , VBR and SYMMETRY analytics as well into this system.rnHEDIS: The Healthcare Effectiveness Data and Information Set (HEDIS) is a set of standardized performance measures related to care and service developed by the National Committee on Quality Assurance (NCQA) and is used by more than 90% of America's health plans.rn• HEDIS is designed to ensure that purchasers and consumers have the information they need to reliably compare the performance of health care plans.rn• Health plans carry out HEDIS measures following exact specifications so that the results are comparable and can be used nationally.rnrnRole:rnPlayed key role in developing the ACC platformrnrnResponsibilities:rn● Involved in developing map reduce jobs.rn● Done R&D on Hadoop frameworks like cascade to implement workflow of jobs.

JobCategory.Comments: Information Technology describes 50% of this job

PositionHistory.Title: Technical Lead
PositionHistory.Description: Description:rnThe UIToolkit is designed to be an implementation of the UX design patterns as well as conform to the Technology Engineering Architecture Council (TEAC) approved System Architecture for the UIToolkit. In addition, it supports many components of the UHG Java Technology Stack that form the base of the OptumInsight Java Technology Stack and Spark security policies.   Right now, It utilizes Java Server Faces (JSF 2.x, Mojarra 2.1.5) and RichFaces 4.0.  As part of next generation, the architecture involves developing components using client side MVC frameworks.rnrnRole:rnPlayed key role in developing POC's on client side java script frameworks for finalizing the architecture.rnrnResponsibilities:rn● Involved in developing POC's on angular , node and express js.

JobCategory.Comments: Information Technology describes 48% of this job

PositionHistory.Title: Technical Lead
PositionHistory.Description: Description:rnChimera is the United Health middleware platform for the creation, testing and execution of business rules and analytics. Chimera provides a high performance, robust, flexible and rapid to use platform to support business in responding to market requirements quickly. Chimera consists of two main elements.rnrnChimera Optimized rules execution system (CORES):rnThe CORES is the component that performs the processing required by the business. This application typically reads input from a source, enriches it with some business rules, and then persists the data to one or more destinations. The CORES provides a number of input and output components that make read and writing data straight forward. The CORES also provides a number of administrative tools that enable process monitoring, process enhancement, termination, error management and other facilities. An important part of CORES is that it provides several convenient and powerful deployment options out of the box.rnrnChimera Application and Rules Store (CARS):rnTypically at the outset of a project rules will be written using IBM Decision Center. However this powerful tool provides very little guidance to the business user. The CARS is the Chimera solution that provides a stripped down, easy to use environment for a business user to add additional rules and artifacts to a pre-built ruleset.rnrnRole:rnPlayed key developer and technical lead roles in team and contributed to the end to end development release of chimera.rnrnResponsibilities:rn● Involved in end to end development of chimera components from scratch

JobCategory.Comments: Information Technology describes 100% of this job

PositionHistory.Title: Enhancement of the Portal installer to optionally install Social communities
PositionHistory.Description: Period: August 2010 - March 2012rnProject: Open Text Social CommunitiesrnrnDescription:rnOpen Text Social Communities provides easy to use social apps that can socially-charge yourrncurrent business processes in a safe and complaint fashion that helps fuel a more immersive userrnexperience both for the social business and the social web. Its features include the followingrnrn• Ready to deploy Social Applications for Social Intranet, Social marketing & Social Workplacern• business processesrn•  Reusable Site templatesrn• Social Community Workspaces for creating & managing sitesrn• Moderation workspace for performing global content moderationrn• An In Context Editing console for modifying a sitern• Activity Feed to get the list of all activities in the sitern• Enhancements to File application to create & manage nested folders within the FilernApplicationrn• Ability to create sub communities within a community (earlier called social groups)rn• Support for OpenID, OAuth authenticationrn• Ability to post content from the community site to Facebook/Twitter/Googlern• Modified User profile management to support multiple sources of usersrn• Application Collection - Ability to create new Applications, e.g., '                            'My own blog'                           'pagern•  Abuse Reporting - Site member ability to report a piece of content as abusive.rn•  Bad word filtering - Filter all user generated content by a set pre defined wordsrn•  Ban a User from specific sitern•  Inline Moderators (Curators) - Ability to feature or delete contentrn•  Integration with Content Server to store all social communities content for compliancernrequirementsrn•  Enhancement of the Portal installer to optionally install Social communitiesrn•  Support for Apache Solr SearchrnrnrnRole:rnPlayed key role in team and contributed to release of  OTSC 8.1 release.rnrnResponsibilities:rnWorked on the following featuresrn● Ability to create sub communities within a community (earlier called social groups)rn● Application Collection - Ability to create new Applications, e.g., '                              'My own blog'                                ' pagern● Bad word filtering - Filter all user generated content by a set pre defined wordsrn● Ban a User from specific sitern● Inline Moderators (Curators) - Ability to feature or delete content

sov:PositionHistoryUserArea.sov:NormalizedTitle: Enhancement of the Portal installer to optionally install Social communities

PositionHistory.Description: Period: July 2008 - August 2010rnProject: FUSION SUPPLY CHAIN MANAGEMENT CATALOGSrnrnDescriptionrnAlternate catalogs are used to organize and classify collections of items. An Alternate Catalog consists of a hierarchy of alternate catalog categories, each containing items assigned to the Alternate Category.  You can define any number of catalogs and assign an item to more than on catalog.  Currently Oracle E-Business suite shares a common data model to support Oracle SCM, CRM, Financials and HCM applications areas. The next generation Fusion Applications will align the common data model to include Seibel CRM.rnThe common product model needs to provide the ability to support defining multiple sales catalogs, provide a mechanism for releasing when these sales catalogs are available to end users through Effectively as well as releasing these catalogs. Additionally catalog security needs to be provided in order to control access to these catalogs during product selection and configuration during order capture, quoting or other transactions that require product selection. Other capabilities would include the ability to provide images, collateral/literature and display templates for presentation and display purposes of these sales catalogs. Users should also be able to import and export these sales catalogs as well syndicate them to other systems consuming catalogs for other operational purposes.rnrnRolernTaken the ownership of Catalogs Module and delivered it in time without much rework.rnrnResponsibilitiesrn● I developed Single Attachment component for fusionapps internal customers.rn● I worked on Fusion catalogs development and delivered it on time to production.rn● I involved in bug fixing for various modules like (Catalogs,ItemClass and Items) with in Product Information Management(SCM).

JobCategory.Comments: Information Technology describes 36% of this job

PositionHistory.Description: Project: FUSION SINGLE ATTACHMENT COMPONENTrnrnDescriptionrnDevelop single attachment component for internal fusion apps customers. This is used to associate image to catalogs, categories and items. This is very highly desirable feature for Oracle CRM and other customers.rnrnRolernBeing unaware of component code, adapted to it and completed it in 15days.rnrnResponsibilitiesrn● Worked with Oracle ST team for attachment component development.

JobCategory.Comments: Human Resources describes 67% of this job

PositionHistory.Description: Project: WU CSCrnrnDescriptionrnWestern Union is subject to a variety of legal requirements that entail pending and reviewing transactions conducted by certain consumers.  The scope of this project is to automate the workflow activities for investigating transactions that are pended / queued for the following reasons like Over Limit, Security and Duplicate Transaction. The project also addresses the functions required to efficiently manage the queues, create new queues, integrate the workflow process and Compliance Analytics, and generate management and queue metrics reports.rnIt involves interaction with several backend components.rn● UNISYS - keeps the all sensitive information about transactions conducted by consumers.rn● Apache MQ - Batch Process is run periodically on UNISYS which retrieves erroneous transactions, determines the process and pushes it to the respective MQ.rn● IBPM - It is a workflow engine which gathers workflow data by executing workflow activities for a process instance created from the process taken from the queue listeners. It interacts with several interfaces to update the work request information in UNISYS.rn● LDAP - makes the application secure by providing authentication and authorization services.rn● External Interfaces to UNISYS (RSI and Property): makes loose coupling withrn● UNISYS and retrieves the requested information effectively.rnThe Requirement was to show the consumer the work request details he conducted and enables him to change the details and submit them by escalating to higher role (or) by reassigning to lower role etc.rnrnRolernActed as Technical POI for Spring / Hibernate Technologies and developed several POCs.

JobCategory.Comments: Information Technology describes 61% of this job

PositionHistory.Description: Project: Application RedesignrnrnDescriptionrnApplication Redesign is a web based application which renders home page for applying credit (or) loan cards. The Requirement was to design four other layouts for the existing apply home page and render it to user randomly. Once the user visits one layout, he keeps on viewing it for next 120 days.rnrnRolernBeing little unaware to CSS Layouts, learned them, designed the layouts and performed 20-20 redirection process.rnrnResponsibilitiesrn• I have done the 20-20 redirection for the all the five layouts of apply home page.rn• I took part in integrating external tracking tags in our code by interacting with external teams.rn• I have maintained our code in Configuration version management (CVS).

JobCategory.Comments: Information Technology describes 50% of this job

PositionHistory.Description: Project: CCSG DynamicApply(RIA)rnrnDescriptionrnCCSG(Consumer Card Services Group)Dynamic Apply is a web based application which enables users to apply for credit cards (or) loans online. It is basically a Flash to DHTML Migration. Along with, the requirement was to perform client side validations and ensure that Flash look and feel remains the same in DHTML. The main Objectives arern●  Performance improvement relative to Flash.rn●  Easily Extendable code to develop for new products.rn●  Implementing the MVC Architecture.rnrnRolernAs a senior developer, I gathered requirements from clients and involved in designing Amex validation framework.rnrnResponsibilitiesrn●  I have involved in Amex validation Framework development in DHTML.rn●  I have worked as a key member in creating struts Templates for all the card products.

JobCategory.Comments: Information Technology describes 60% of this job

PositionHistory.Description: Project: International Next Generation E-ApplyrnrnDescriptionrnInternational Next Generation apply (INGA) is a web based application which enables user to apply for cards (charge / credit, business cards, supplementary, add on cards, bank loans) on line. The application collects the user data along with his financial / bank details and is intelligent enough to give back a decision as to whether the applicant is eligible for a card.rnrnThe scope of this project extends to 19 countries and involves interaction with more than 20 third party dependent systems. INGA is a migration cum development project where the existing application (Eapply) is to be migrated from 3.5 websphere to 5.1 websphere server. Along with the migration, the requirement was to completely rewrite the entire code base. The objectives of the project arern● Deliver faster time to market for new products.rn● Lower costs towards new productsrn● Improve the performance of the system.rn● Ensure International eApplication is supported by IBMrnrnRolernKey resource in the project and mentored colleagues.rnrnResponsibilitiesrn● involved in the development of new processes and the design artifacts of this project.rn● involved in analyzing the impact of the new development on the existing system, Creation of Design documents, Development and Testing.rn● Was responsible for delivering Proof of Concepts for the INGA Project.rn● Involvement in end to end development and bug fixing.rn● Was Responsible for designing the framework for INGA Batch.rn● Was Responsible for delivering the batch for Australia, France, Italy and Hong Kong markets.rn● Was Responsible for delivering the Japan INGA Application.rn● Involved in bug fixing for Various Market applications.

Project: My Amex Home PagernrnDescriptionrnThis Project is the migration of Amex Home Page to Flash Environment. This involves the following phasesrn● Learning - Flash Amex Components.rn● Learning - Amex Framework for the project.rn● Restructuring of the Amex components.rn● Implementing the components in the project.rnrnRolernDriven this by implementing the components with-in expected dead line.rnrnResponsibilitiesrn● I have involved in Flash Amex Components Phase and restructured some of the flash amex components.rn● I have given Knowledge Transfer for the new Joinees about Flash Amex Components used in our project.

Additionally catalog security needs to be provided in order to control access to these catalogs during product selection and configuration during order capture, quoting or other transactions that require product selection. Other capabilities would include the ability to provide images, collateral/literature and display templates for presentation and display purposes of these sales catalogs. Users should also be able to import and export these sales catalogs as well syndicate them to other systems consuming catalogs for other operational purposes.rnrnRolernrnTaken the ownership of Catalogs Module and delivered it in time without much rework.rnrnResponsibilitiesrn● I developed Single Attachment component for fusionapps internal customers.rn● I worked on Fusion catalogs development and delivered it on time to production.rn● I involved in bug fixing for various modules like (Catalogs,ItemClass and Items) with in Product Information Management(SCM).rnrnrnCompany: Open TexttPeriod: August 2010 - March 2012rnProject: Open Text Social CommunitiesrnrnDescription:rnrnOpen Text Social Communities provides easy to use social apps that can socially-charge yourrncurrent business processes in a safe and complaint fashion that helps fuel a more immersive userrnexperience both for the social business and the social web. Its features include the followingrnrn• Ready to deploy Social Applications for Social Intranet, Social marketing & Social Workplacern• business processesrn•  Reusable Site templatesrn• Social Community Workspaces for creating & managing sitesrn• Moderation workspace for performing global content moderationrn• An In Context Editing console for modifying a sitern• Activity Feed to get the list of all activities in the sitern• Enhancements to File application to create & manage nested folders within the FilernApplicationrn• Ability to create sub communities within a community (earlier called social groups)rn• Support for OpenID, OAuth authenticationrn• Ability to post content from the community site to Facebook/Twitter/Googlern• Modified User profile management to support multiple sources of usersrn• Application Collection - Ability to create new Applications, e.g.,'          'My own blog'            ' pagern•  Abuse Reporting - Site member ability to report a piece of content as abusive.rn•  Bad word filtering - Filter all user generated content by a set pre defined wordsrn•  Ban a User from specific sitern•  Inline Moderators (Curators) - Ability to feature or delete contentrn•  Integration with Content Server to store all social communities content for compliancernrequirementsrn•  Enhancement of the Portal installer to optionally install Social communitiesrn•  Support for Apache Solr SearchrnrnrnRole:rnrnPlayed key role in team and contributed to release of  OTSC 8.1 release.rnrnResponsibilities:rnrnWorked on the following featuresrn● Ability to create sub communities within a community (earlier called social groups)rn● Application Collection - Ability to create new Applications, e.g., '            'My own blog'            ' pagern● Bad word filtering - Filter all user generated content by a set pre defined wordsrn● Ban a User from specific sitern● Inline Moderators (Curators) - Ability to feature or delete contentrnrnrnCompany: UnitedHealth GrouptPeriod: March 2012 - Jan 2013rnProject: ChimeratTechnical LeadrnrnDescription:rnrnChimera is the United Health middleware platform for the creation, testing and execution of business rules and analytics. Chimera provides a high performance, robust, flexible and rapid to use platform to support business in responding to market requirements quickly. Chimera consists of two main elements.rnrnChimera Optimized rules execution system (CORES):rnThe CORES is the component that performs the processing required by the business. This application typically reads input from a source, enriches it with some business rules, and then persists the data to one or more destinations. The CORES provides a number of input and output components that make read and writing data straight forward. The CORES also provides a number of administrative tools that enable process monitoring, process enhancement, termination, error management and other facilities. An important part of CORES is that it provides several convenient and powerful deployment options out of the box.rnrnChimera Application and Rules Store (CARS):rnTypically at the outset of a project rules will be written using IBM Decision Center. However this powerful tool provides very little guidance to the business user. The CARS is the Chimera solution that provides a stripped down, easy to use environment for a business user to add additional rules and artifacts to a pre-built ruleset.rnrnRole:rnrnPlayed key developer and technical lead roles in team and contributed to the end to end development release of chimera.rnrnResponsibilities:rnrn● Involved in end to end development of chimera components from scratchrnrnrnCompany: UnitedHealth GrouptPeriod: Jan 2013 - March 2013rnProject: UIToolkittTechnical LeadrnrnDescription:rnThe UIToolkit is designed to be an implementation of the UX design patterns as well as conform to the Technology Engineering Architecture Council (TEAC) approved System Architecture for the UIToolkit. In addition, it supports many components of the UHG Java Technology Stack that form the base of the OptumInsight Java Technology Stack and Spark security policies.   Right now, It utilizes Java Server Faces (JSF 2.x, Mojarra 2.1.5) and RichFaces 4.0.  As part of next generation, the architecture involves developing components using client side MVC frameworks.rnrnRole:rnrnPlayed key role in developing POC's on client side java script frameworks for finalizing the architecture.rnrnResponsibilities:rnrn● Involved in developing POC's on angular , node and express js.rnrnrnCompany:UnitedHealthGrouptMarch 2013 - April 2015rnProject: Analytical common Capability (ACC)tTechnical LeadrnrnDescription:rnAnalytical Common Capability(ACC) is common platform used in optum to process the  health care analytics  such as HEDIS, STAR, VBR and SYMMETRY. The aim of this project to bring processing of all analytics under one umbrella and use Hadoop for high scalability. Right now HEDIS is the only analytic which is brought to ACC. The future scope of this project is to bring STAR , VBR and SYMMETRY analytics as well into this system.rnHEDIS: The Healthcare Effectiveness Data and Information Set (HEDIS) is a set of standardized performance measures related to care and service developed by the National Committee on Quality Assurance (NCQA) and is used by more than 90% of America's health plans.rn• HEDIS is designed to ensure that purchasers and consumers have the information they need to reliably compare the performance of health care plans.rn• Health plans carry out HEDIS measures following exact specifications so that the results are comparable and can be used nationally.rnrnRole:rnrnPlayed key role in developing the ACC platformrnrnResponsibilities:rnrn● Involved in developing map reduce jobs.rn● Done R&D on Hadoop frameworks like cascade to implement workflow of jobs.rnrnrnCompany:Pega SystemstApril 2015 - till nowrnProject: Platform Engineering & DevopstManager & ArchitectrnrnDescription:rnrnPega's adaptive, cloud-architected software - built on its unified Pega® Platform - empowers people to rapidly deploy, and easily extend applications to meet strategic business needs. Over its 30-year history, Pega has delivered award-winning capabilities in CRM and BPM, powered by advanced artificial intelligence and robotic automation, to help the world's leading brands achieve breakthrough business results. This project aims at enabling devops for pega with various things likernrn- Technology modernization -single source of truthrn- Platform Development changes to align with Devopsrn- Testing strategy and toolsrn- Devops solution for product & applications & it's customersrnrnRole:rnrnPlayed manager / technical lead/ technical architect for team of 10 membersrnrnResponsibilities:rnrn● Involved in end-to-end design and development of devops solution for Pegarn● Involved in end-to-end design testing strategy for PegarnrnrnHotCompilertOpenSourceProjectrnrnDescriptionrnDeveloped Tool for auto compile and reload of  java files on save.  With this, you could see your changes reflecting on save just like a scripting language. Its features include the followingrn• multiple project monitoring for auto compile & reload on savern• import the project configuration from build tools like antrn• import and export of project settingsrn• hot swap through different debug transports like socket and shared memoryrn• hot swap through java agentrn• project clean/incremental compilernrnMore info about it can be found at http://hotcompiler.wordpress.com/ and It is uploaded to sourceforge at http://sourceforge.net/projects/hotcompiler/files/rnrnrnPersonal Details:rnrnDate of Birth: 30-08-1985rnFather's Name: LAKSHMI NARAYANArnName: T.V.S.S.RADHA KRISHNArnGender: MalernLanguages: English, Hindi and Telugu.

sov:ExperienceSummary.sov:Description: T.V.S.S. RADHA KRISHNA's experience appears to be strongly concentrated in Information Technology (mostly Java) and slightly concentrated in Human Resources (mostly Talent Sourcing). T.V.S.S. RADHA KRISHNA has 15 years of work experience, with 8 years of management experience, including a mid-level position.
sov:ExperienceSummary.sov:ManagementStory: Current position is a mid-level management role: Software Engineering ManagerrnStarting on 4/1/2015, the candidate held the following mid-level management position for 4 years and 11 months:rntTitle: Software Engineering Manager for Pega SystemsrnStarting on 3/1/2013, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 2 years and 1 months:rntTitle: Technical Lead for UnitedHealthGrouprnStarting on 1/1/2013, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 1 months:rntTitle: Technical Lead for UnitedHealth GrouprnStarting on 3/1/2012, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 10 months:rntTitle: Technical Lead for UnitedHealth Group

sov:Information: [Sovren:311;] The resume contains a contact information section that is not the first section. A resume should always include the candidate's contact info at the top of the resume.
[Sovren:323;WORK HISTORY] The following section type appeared multiple times in the resume: WORK HISTORY (2 occurrences). Each section type should only appear once in a resume.
[Sovren:213;] A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
[Sovren:221;POS-12,POS-11,POS-10,POS-9,POS-8,POS-7,POS-6] We could not find a job title for: POS-12, POS-11, POS-10, POS-9, POS-8, POS-7, POS-6. Every position in a resume should have a job title.
[Sovren:222;POS-3] No employer name was found for:  POS-3. Every position in a resume should have an employer name.

[Sovren:223;POS-5,POS-17] The following positions are currently active and at the same company: POS-5, POS-17. It is very rare to be currently employed at the same company under two different jobs. One of these positions is likely missing an end date or formatted poorly.
[Sovren:231;DEG-2,DEG-3] The following educational degrees do not have a degree name: DEG-2, DEG-3. Every degree in a resume should have a name or type associated with it, such as 'B.S.' or 'M.S.'.

[Sovren:112;] The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'TECHNICAL PROFILE'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education.

[Sovren:151;7] The following section does not have the header on a separate line: 'Languages'. Every section should have a clear, unambiguous, commonly-used header on a separate line directly above the content associated with it.
